Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a bump on my forearm that has been there for a few years and has grown slightly larger over the past year. It sometimes hurts, and recently another similar bump has appeared near it.
Has there been any change in color or bleeding from these bumps?
No, there has been no change in color or bleeding from these bumps.
Do you have any similar bumps elsewhere on your body?
No, I don't have any similar bumps elsewhere on my body.
Do any of your immediate family members have similar skin issues or a history of skin cancer?
No, my family has no history of skin cancer or similar skin issues.
Have you noticed any changes to the surface of the bump, such as becoming more rough or scaly?
No, the surface of the bump is intact and hasn't become rough or scaly.
Have you had any recent infections, injuries, or illnesses that might be related to these bumps?
No, I haven't had any recent infections, injuries, or illnesses related to these bumps.

No, I am not currently taking any medications and have not taken any in the past for these bumps or any other condition.
Final Diagnosis: Dermatofibroma.
